org.pircbotx.hooks

Class Event<T extends PircBotX>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pircbotx.hooks.Event<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionEvent, ChannelInfoEvent, ConnectEvent, DisconnectEvent, FileTransferFinishedEvent, FingerEvent, HalfOpEvent, IncomingChatRequestEvent, IncomingFileTransferEvent, InviteEvent, JoinEvent, KickEvent, MessageEvent, ModeEvent, MotdEvent, NickChangeEvent, NoticeEvent, OpEvent, OwnerEvent, PartEvent, PingEvent, PrivateMessageEvent, QuitEvent, ReconnectEvent, RemoveChannelBanEvent, RemoveChannelKeyEvent, RemoveChannelLimitEvent, RemoveInviteOnlyEvent, RemoveModeratedEvent, RemoveNoExternalMessagesEvent, RemovePrivateEvent, RemoveSecretEvent, RemoveTopicProtectionEvent, ServerPingEvent, ServerResponseEvent, SetChannelBanEvent, SetChannelKeyEvent, SetChannelLimitEvent, SetInviteOnlyEvent, SetModeratedEvent, SetNoExternalMessagesEvent, SetPrivateEvent, SetSecretEvent, SetTopicProtectionEvent, SocketConnectEvent, SuperOpEvent, TimeEvent, TopicEvent, UnknownEvent, UserListEvent, UserModeEvent, VersionEvent, VoiceEvent, WhoisEvent

extends Object

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getBot()
      Returns the PircBotX instance that this event originally came from
      long getId()
      Returns the id of this event.
      long getTimestamp()
      Returns the timestamp of when the event was created
      abstract void respond(String response)
      A simple abstract method that all events must implement to respond to an event happening.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event(T bot)

    • Method Detail

      • getBot

        public T getBot()
        Returns the PircBotX instance that this event originally came from
        Returns:
        A PircBotX instance

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Returns the timestamp of when the event was created
        Returns:
        A timestamp as a long

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Returns the id of this event. This id is guaranteed to be unique in the context of other events dispatched from the same listener managers
        Returns:
        The id of this event

      • respond

        public abstract void respond(String response)
        A simple abstract method that all events must implement to respond to an event happening. All implementing classes should delegate to the sendMessage or other relevant methods in the main PircBotX class, not with custom lines and calls to PircBotX.sendRawLine(java.lang.String)
        Parameters:
        response - The response to send
